question.body: When taking the pulse from behind the knee, which artery is being palpated?

response.feedback: Incorrect. The anterior tibial arteries divide into the dorsalis pedis arteries, which can be used to assess the peripheral vascular system.
Correct. The popliteal arteries can be palpated behind the knee to measure pulse.
Incorrect. The fibular arteries are below the knee.
Incorrect. The pulse of the femoral arteries can be felt under the inguinal ligament.
